sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The nail & the wheel the nail fastned by a hand from heaven, the wheel turned by a voyce from the throne of glory / both described in two severall sermons in the Green-yard at Norwich by John Carter, pastor of Great St. Peters. Carter, John, d. 1655.
108 [i.e. 106] p. : ill.
Printed by J. Macock for M. Spark, and are to be sold by William Franklin ..., London : 1647.
"The nail hit on the head, and driven into the city and cathedral wall of Norwich" and "The wheel turned by a voice from the throne of glory" each have special t.p. and continuous paging. Illustrated frontispiece for "The vvheel turned by a voice" on p. 52. Contains errors in paging. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
The nail & the wheel the nail fastned by a hand from heaven, the wheel turned by a voyce from the throne of glory / both described in two severall sermons in the Green-yard at Norwich by John Carter, pastor of Great St. Peters. Carter, John, d. 1655.
108 [i.e. 106] p. : ill.
Printed by J. Macock for M. Spark, and are to be sold by William Franklin ..., London : 1647.
"The nail hit on the head, and driven into the city and cathedral wall of Norwich" and "The wheel turned by a voice from the throne of glory" each have special t.p. and continuous paging. Illustrated frontispiece for "The vvheel turned by a voice" on p. 52. Contains errors in paging. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
